articles.title: Did Pakistan actually vow nuke-for-nuke strike on Israel for Iran? Yes, says Tehran; Islamabad differs
articles.description: A top Iranian official has claimed that Pakistan would launch a nuclear strike on Israel if it used nuclear weapons against Iran—a claim swiftly denied by Islamabad. The remarks come amid soaring tensions, marked by missile exchanges and escalating rhetoric.

articles.description: OnePlus on Monday formally announced the launch of OnePlus Nord 5 and OnePlus Nord CE 5 on July 8 at 2PM IST. The Chinese smartphone company will also launch the OnePlus Buds 4 along with Nord 5 series
articles.content:

articles.title: 18 OFWs return home amid Israel-Iran conflict, one in ICU
articles.description: MANILA – The Philippine government is ramping up efforts in protecting overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) caught in the Middle East crossfire amid the escalating tension between Israel and Iran. On Monday, the Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) and the Overseas Workers Welfare Administration…
articles.content: REPATRIATED. A total of 18 overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) caught in the Middle East crossfire safely arrive home on Monday (June 16, 2025) at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 1 in Pasay City. The Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) a... [4226 chars]

articles.title: Civil servants to receive 0.4-month mid-year bonus; one-time payment for junior grade officers
articles.description: The mid-year bonus takes into consideration Singapore’s economic performance in the first quarter of 2025 and the "subdued economic outlook", says the Public Service Division.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE: Civil servants in Singapore will receive a 0.4-month mid-year bonus, with junior grade officers getting an additional one-time payment of up to S$400 (US$312), the Public Service Division (PSD) said on Monday (Jun 16).

articles.description: The WECHU has urged organizers of summer activities to know what to do if measles shows up uninvited.
articles.content:
By Mark Brown

articles.title: DOTr eyes privatization of 10 more airports until 2028
articles.description: The current administration is set to privatize the operations of at least 10 more regional airports, some located in tourist destinations, for the remaining three years of its term, Transportation Secretary Vivencio “Vince” Dizon said Monday.
